questions.q: What is the definition of a computer network?
questions.explanation: A network consists of two or more computers connected together for communicating and sharing resources [1, 2]. Uses of a network include sharing hardware, sharing data, and data protection [3].
options: A software application that displays web content
Two or more computers connected together to communicate and share resources
A private network contained within a single organization
A unique set of numbers identifying a computer location

questions.q: Which of the following is an advantage of the internet?
questions.explanation: Internet advantages include social networking, education and technology, entertainment, and online services [4]. Disadvantages include spamming, cyber crime, and threats to personal information [4].
options: Spamming
Cyber Crime
Education and technology
Threat to personal information

questions.q: What is the main difference between a LAN and a WAN?
questions.explanation: A LAN (Local Area Network) is usually confined to a single building or limited area like a school or home [5]. A WAN (Wide Area Network) uses public or commercial communications to connect computers in widely dispersed geographical areas [5].
options: LAN is more expensive than WAN
WAN is confined to a single building, while LAN is worldwide
LAN is confined to a limited area like a home or school, while WAN connects computers over widely dispersed geographical areas
LAN uses public communication networks while WAN is private

questions.q: In the context of network safety and reliability, how does an Intranet compare to the Internet?
questions.explanation: An Intranet is a localized private network that is more safe and reliable than the Internet [6]. However, it is also more expensive than the Internet [6].
options: The Internet is more safe and reliable
An Intranet is localized and is generally more safe and reliable than the Internet
There is no difference in safety
An Intranet is less expensive and less safe

questions.q: In the Client/Server model, what is the role of the client?
questions.explanation: The client requests a service from the server, while the server fulfills that request and transmits results back to the client over the network [7]. In the Internet model, the web browser is the client and the web server is the server [7].
options: To fulfill requests and transmit results
To store the web resources and files
To request a service, such as a file or database access, from the server
To manage the network hardware

questions.q: Which of the following is a property of an IP address?
questions.explanation: An IP address is a 32-bit (4-byte) unique logical address where each byte is represented by a number from 0 to 255 separated by dots [8]. It identifies a specific computer location [8].
options: It is 64 bits long
It consists of four bytes, each ranging from 0 to 255
It is used to design the layout of a web page
It is a human-readable name for a website

questions.q: What is the primary purpose of the Domain Name System (DNS)?
questions.explanation: The DNS associates domain names with IP addresses and translates them automatically so the browser can locate the server [9].
options: To protect the network from viruses
To provide a backup for web server files
To automatically translate domain names into IP addresses
To define the formatting of an HTML document

questions.q: Which protocol is specifically used for sending emails?
questions.explanation: SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is used for sending e-mail [10]. POP3 and IMAP are used for receiving e-mail [10].
options: POP3
IMAP
SMTP
FTP

questions.q: What is the difference between a web developer and a web designer?
questions.explanation: Web developers handle the coding and programming, whereas web designers design the theme, layout, and color schemes used to put the site together [11].
options: Developers design the images, while designers do the coding
Developers are responsible for coding and programming, while designers decide the theme, layout, and color scheme
Designers manage the server, while developers manage the browser
There is no difference between the two roles

questions.q: What technologies comprise the 'Front-End' of a website?
questions.explanation: The front end is the part users interact with and is a combination of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript controlled by the web browser [12].
options: PHP, Ruby, and Python
MySQL, Oracle, and SQL Server
HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
The physical server hardware

questions.q: Which definition best describes a Full Stack Developer?
questions.explanation: A full stack web developer can develop both client and server software, mastering HTML, CSS, and programming for browsers, servers, and databases [13].
options: A developer who only focuses on database management
A person who can develop both client and server software
A designer who specializes in CSS and layout
A developer who only works with hardware networking

questions.q: What is the purpose of the HTTP protocol?
questions.explanation: HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) is a set of rules for exchanging text, graphics, sound, video, and other multimedia files on the web [11]. Browsers send HTTP requests, and servers send HTTP responses [11].
options: To exchange files like text, images, and multimedia on the Web
To assign unique 32-bit addresses to computers
To transfer files specifically between local computers and a server for storage
To provide a private connection for employees
